args:
Chairman Emile's lecture is set to begin! Our
heroes are on pins and needles wondering what
devilish brainwashing awaits these poor kids,
only to learn that it's...art class? And what info
can Mercury extract from Emile with her wiles?
The day of Chairman Emile's campus visit...
We got any clue what Emile's\nlecture is gonna be about?
None. It seems even Mercury hasn't been\nbriefed. It's odd that even the faculty would\nbe kept in the dark.
Just what is that weasel plotting this time?
Your attention please, children. As I\nmentioned earlier, the academy chairman\nwill be conducting your lesson today.
Heh heh. Consider yourselves lucky to\nstudy under a genius of my caliber!
(Wow, that's...quite an attitude. He's\neven more of a creep than I'd heard.)
Now, sir. What sort of lesson have you\nprepared for the children today?
I see I've intrigued you. It's little wonder—\na rare talent like myself is qualified to\nteach any number of subjects, after all.
(Did he make the trip out here to put these\nkids through the combat wringer himself?)
(Where's your pride as a grown man,\nforcing kids out onto the battlefield?!)
Today, I shall instruct you in...the fine arts!\nWe're drawing pretty pictures!
You there, disheveled child. Care to share\nyour muttering with the rest of the class?
Oh, uh... I was only saying how the lesson\nsounds great. Just...why drawing?
I beg your pardon? Because I happen to\nbe GOOD at drawing, that's why!
Are the visual arts your specialty,\nthen, Mr. Chairman?
Indeed! Even my elder siblings could never\nmatch me in this (and only this) field!
True, it was never an especially\nUSEFUL skill...
But what of it? It's a talent I can flaunt\naround you whelps! Haa ha ha ha!
Ha ha. Shall we begin the lesson, sir?
(Am I imagining things, or did it feel like\nsomeone wanted to murder me just now?)
Yikes. Mercury just sent a shiver down\nMY back.
And mine. With her here, I suspect we've\nlittle reason to worry about Emile getting\nout of hand.
Agreed. I guess we oughta just sit\nback and watch how class unfolds.
Children, let's all draw our best portraits\nof Chairman Emile!
No doubt they'll all be masterpieces, given\nthe subject! Just know any unflattering\ndepictions will meet with swift reprisal.
Don't worry, children. If your portrait\ndoesn't turn out well, that isn't your fault.
It's just the sign of a lackluster mod—er,\nthat you haven't yet received sufficient\nguidance from the Chairman.
If you find yourself struggling, don't\nhesitate to come up and ask him for help.
I'm certain he'll have kind and thoughtful\nanswers to all of your questions.
...Yes, ma'am! I'll do my best, ma'am!
Thank heavens that's over. I'm exhausted.\nEr, I mean... Practice and dedication, kids!\nPractice and dedication!
I guess it's over. I'm relieved he didn't\nhave anything dangerous in store today.
But we got zilch from that, intel-wise. I say\nwe ask him flat out why he's goin' around\nbuilding schools like this.
I have my own idea.\nWhy don't you two run along?
Let's trust Mercury on this one. C'mon.
I...I was rocked to my core by your\nunparalleled teaching ability today, sir.\nSo much that, well...
I'll be waiting for you behind the main hall\nafter school. If it isn't a bother, I would\ndearly love to share aaall of my...feelings.
Don't keep me waiting... Mr. Chairman.
What was... Was that—was\nshe just f-f-f...FLIRTING with me?!\nWhoaaa, I... I am AMAZING!
But then, what was that death glare\nearlier? Ah, I know!
She instantly fell so deeply in love\nwith me, she couldn't help but stare!
I AM royalty, after all. Some K-12 floozy\nis hardly a suitable match for me.
...But she IS a beauty. I suppose I'll grant\nher the privilege of professing her love to\nme. Eee hee hee. Emile, you dog, you!
All right. Let the prostration commence!
Behind the Main Hall, After School
I, uh... I figured I'd throw you a bone\nand at least hear you out or whatever.
Oh, I'm so terribly flattered, Chairman.\nThank you, sir.
Yes, and? I was led to believe you had\nsomething you wished to share with me?
(Here it comes here it comes here it\ncomes here it comes oh boy oh boy oh—)
I'm head over heels, sir...\nFor this academy.
Sorry to disappoint you, sweetheart, but\nyou and I just aren't—wait. The academy?

Oh, yes, sir. It's so warm and peaceful.
Practically a second home to me already.
Tell me, Chairman: what made you
decide to build such a wonderful place?
Er... I think my aides said something about\n＂cultivating the talent that will lead\nDyrenell into the future＂ or somesuch?
And I was already looking for places I\ncould showboat and boss people around to\nblow off steam, so it worked out perfectly.
Anyway, can we back up to the ＂feelings\nrocking your core＂ part? Sounded like you\nhad something to confess...?
Oh, my dear Chairman... Surely you didn't\ncome here thinking I wanted to profess my\nlove to you?
Oh goodness, no. No, no, no. ...HAH! No.\nSir, I would never fall for a man such as\nyourself. Ever. Not in a million years.
Hey! What's THAT supposed to mean?!
That I could never hope to be a match\nfor one so noble as yourself, of course.\nPardon me if my language was unclear.
Grk... Yeah! I AM noble! I am Emperor of\nDyrenell and Chairman of this academy!
And as its wise and generous chairman,\nI'm deigning to listen to the thoughts of a\nhumble teacher.
So don't go getting ideas, missy! Don't\nthink that just because you're really...\nREALLY gorgeous, you can just... Just...
IT WASN'T A COMPLIMENT! Rrgh, I can't\nstomach this. I'm outta here. BYE.
Ah, my liege. There you are. I wanted to\nspeak with you regarding the secret\nweapon in—
SHHH! Do you want the whole world to\noverhear you?! I've told you that's SECRET.\nTOP. SECRET!
Once that's complete, everyone on this\ncampus will know my might! It's very,\nincredibly, EXTREMELY important!
Forgive me, sir. I'd like to consult with you\nabout the you-know-what while we actually\nlook at it. Shall we head to your office?
How kind of him to spell it out for me.
Well, Mercury's uncovered the purpose\nbehind this place, at least.
To ＂cultivate the talent that will lead\nDyrenell into the future.＂
Pretty much what we expected, really.\nSeems downright chill here, least for now.\nProbably no cause for worry anytime soon.
Would that it were so. But I fear danger\nmay be closer at hand than you suspect.
Oh? Did you get something else out of\nEmile, Mercury?
Once that's complete, everyone on this\ncampus will know my might! It's very,\nincredibly, EXTREMELY important!
Well, THAT'S concerning.\nWhat could this weapon be?
You sayin' he's got something that scary\ntucked away in a place this peaceful?
Perhaps that idyllic exterior is the\nperfect camouflage.
A magic device? Or some new armament?\nThe children here could be in danger!
Yes. From what they said, it's apparently\nbeing kept in the chairman's office.
Hm. We'll have to find some way inside...
They may have heard us.\nWe can't afford to wait around.
Not to mention we're on a countdown to\nNaked Town... AHEM. We don't know\nwhen our bodies will return to normal.
We must uncover Emile's secret weapon.\nAnd for that, we must infiltrate his office.
